Edition.description: Visual Studio Edition (Enterprise, Professional or Community)

Channel.description: Install from latest release channel, or from preview channel?

Workloads.description:
Install all workloads? Or install a few from a list?

Select Below
Installs specific workloads from the "Workload List" (see below)
All Workloads
Installs all workloads with the basic required components
All with Recommended
Installs all workloads with recommended components
All with Optional
Installs all workloads with optional components
All with Recommended and Optional
Installs all workloads with recommended and optional components
Complete
Installs all workloads with all components, including unaffiliated components

WorkloadList.description:
Comma-separated list of workloads. See Reference

Use a suffix to include additional components:
[+] include recommended, [*] include optional, [+*] include recommended and optional

Ex: Azure+,NetWeb*,Data+*

NetWeb
ASP.NET and web development
Azure
Azure development
Data
Data storage and processing
DataScience
Data science and analytical applications
ManagedDesktop
.NET desktop development
ManagedGame
Game development with Unity
NetCrossPlat
Mobile development with .NET
Node
Node.js development
Office
Office/SharePoint development
Python
Python development
Universal
Universal Windows Platform development
NativeCrossPlat
Linux development with C++
NativeDesktop
Desktop development with C++
NativeGame
Game development with C++
NativeMobile
Mobile development with C++
VisualStudioExtension
Visual Studio extension development
NetCoreTools
.NET cross-platform development (2017 and 2019 only)
WebCrossPlat
Mobile development with JavaScript (VS2017 only)

Languages.description: You can specify multiple languages using a comma-separated list (,). Available values are here

Key.description: Visual Studio key in the format aaaaa-bbbbb-ccccc-ddddd-eeeee. Leave empty for 30 day trial. No product key needed for Community edition. Switch from trial to licensed at any time using your product key or by entering your VS account credentials.

Components.description:
Comma-separated list of individual components. See Reference

Ex: Microsoft.Component.Azure.DataLake.Tools,Microsoft.NetCore.Component.Runtime.6.0

Restart.description: After install, restart the OS, if needed.

runCommand.commandToExecute: [concat('powerShell.exe -ExecutionPolicy bypass " & ''.\visualstudio.ps1'' -Edition ', parameters('Edition'), ' -VsVersion ', parameters('VsVersion'), ' -Channel ', parameters('Channel'), ' -Workloads ''' , parameters('Workloads')  , ''' -WorkloadList ''' , parameters('WorkloadList')  , ''' -Languages ''' , parameters('Languages')  , '''  -Key ''', parameters('Key'), ''' -Components ''', parameters('Components'), '''  -Restart ''',  parameters('Restart')  , '''  "'  )]
